channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: With India’s corporate banking lagging decades behind consumer fintech, TransBnk raises $25M to bridge the gap
item.description: TransBnk has raised $25 million in a round led by Bessemer Venture Partners to digitize India’s corporate banking.

item.title: Top CDC Officials Resign After Director Is Pushed Out
item.description: The exodus has set off alarms among staff at the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: “My main concern is they will be replaced with puppets...

item.title: Best Window Air Conditioners 2025: 11 Picks to Cool You for Years
item.description: These WIRED-tested AC units have been lodged into our windows and cooling our homes for months, if not years.

item.title: WhatsApp’s new AI feature lets you rephrase and adjust the tone of your messages
item.description: With Writing Help, users can get AI-generated suggestions that rewrite their messages in professional, funny, supportive, or rephrased way.

item.title: Google launches new device protection program called Pixel Care+
item.description: Google says Pixel Care+ provides a "higher level of coverage, service and peace of mind for Google hardware owners."

item.title: Nvidia reports record sales as the AI boom continues
item.description: Nvidia's revenue hit $46.7 billion in the second quarter, a 56% increase compared to the same period last year.

item.title: Save 20 Percent on Our Favorite Android Earbuds
item.description: The Nothing Ear (a) are svelte and elegant, with great sound quality and a more compelling price than ever.

item.title: 911 centers are so understaffed, they’re turning to AI to answer calls
item.description: The company offers an AI voice assistant that helps 911 centers handle non-emergency calls.

item.title: Google Pixel 10, Pixel 10 Pro, and Pixel 10 Pro XL Review
item.description: Google’s trio of 10th-generation Pixels is better than ever, but there’s an off-putting dose of generative Al.

item.title: This Is the Group That's Been Swatting US Universities
item.description: WIRED spoke to a self-proclaimed leader of an online group called Purgatory, which charged as little as $20 to call in fake threats against schools.
